#Text=Make Your Apartment Bathroom Look and Feel Larger
#Text=Unless you 're living in your own home , you may find yourself wishing for a larger bathroom .
#Text=While it ’s not a problem for homeowners to completely remodel and redecorate , apartment renters are rather limited .
#Text=It can be a challenge , because you have to work with what is provided .
#Text=There ’s still a lot you can do without replacing tiles or knocking down walls .
#Text=With a little bit of planning , some creative organizational skills and clever use of color , you can easily make your apartment bathroom seem more spacious than it really is .
#Text=These simple decorating tips are quick , easy , and best of all , cheap .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Color
#Text=If your landlord approves , you may be able to paint .
#Text=Colors of the same tone create an illusion of greater space .
#Text=Choose soft , pale , neutral pastels for both the walls and the flooring .
#Text=Use a large rug to cover dark or unflattering floor tiles .
#Text=Bright , strong and exciting colors ( such as red ) should be saved for accessories and towels .
#Text=Mirrors
#Text=Mirrors provide an illusion of expansion without adding a single square foot .
#Text=Consider a few small mirrors arranged artistically throughout the room .
#Text=Replace a bulky medicine chest with a wall mirror .
#Text=Store a first-aid kit in a kitchen cupboard .
#Text=Try one full-length mirror on the back of the bathroom door .
#Text=Declutter
#Text=A clean , neat bathroom will always look bigger .
#Text=Yes , this means you ’ll have to spend some serious time organizing your stuff .
#Text=Cut down on the number of towels , rugs , pieces of art and decorative accessories .
#Text=Use one large rug or runner instead of several small rugs .
#Text=Items that are infrequently used should be stored out of sight .
#Text=This does n’t mean you have to hide everything out of sight , though .
#Text=There are plenty of attractive smaller storage options that allow you to put your items in place and on display at the same time .
#Text=Tall and thin cabinets always come in handy when space is at a premium .
#Text=Vertical displays also create an illusion of greater space in height .
#Text=Narrow shelving over the toilet will not impinge upon floor space .
#Text=Fold towels in thirds to stack neatly on the shelves .
#Text=Store cosmetics in a basket on the shelf .
#Text=Include a toothbrush case , toothpaste and a small glass in a separate basket .
#Text=Place the more cluttered basket on a higher shelf so that the contents will not be within view .
#Text=Provide space for a tissue box .
#Text=Keep these shelves limited to a few items that require quick access on a daily basis .
#Text=Avoid multiple dispensers and holders around the sink . #Replace a wide soap dish with a thin liquid soap dispenser .
#Text=Place a towel hook near shower and sink .
#Text=Place a garment hook on the back of the bathroom door .
#Text=Try to avoid using a rack with multiple hooks in an already crowded space .
#Text=One hook and one item on the hook provides for a neat appearance .
#Text=Once dressed , remove all garments from the bathroom .
#Text=Decide what items can be kept elsewhere - other than in the bathroom .
#Text=Store your bathrobe on a hook in your bedroom closet instead of on the back of the bathroom door .
#Text=Store your laundry in a pillowcase hung on a hook in your bedroom closet .
#Text=Store your scale beneath your bed or a bedroom chair .
#Text=Visual Pathway
#Text=With a single swoop of the arm – push back the shower curtain to one side when it ’s not in use .
#Text=If you can see all the way to the back wall ( instead of just to the curtain ) , your eye will think the room is larger .
#Text=One sheer curtain covering the entire window will provide privacy and abundant light during the day .
#Text=A shade behind the curtain can be pulled down at night .
#Text=If fixtures are being replaced , consider a small corner sink .
#Text=Tips
